Package game

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.State
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class State
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Container class for holding the configurations and velocities of the entire runner at a single instance in time. Has x, y, th, dx, dy, dth for 12 bodies, meaning that one State represents 72 state values.
    Author:
    matt
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  State.ObjectName
      Name of each body part.
      static class  State.StateName
      Name of each state value (configurations and velocities).

    • Constructor Detail

      • State

        public State​(float[] stateVars,
             boolean isFailed)
        Make new state from list of ordered numbers. Most useful for interacting with neural network stuff. Number order is essential.
        Parameters:
        stateVars - Array of state variable values. Order matches TensorFlow in/out order.
        isFailed - Whether this state represents a fallen runner.

      • State

        public State​(StateVariable bodyS,
             StateVariable headS,
             StateVariable rthighS,
             StateVariable lthighS,
             StateVariable rcalfS,
             StateVariable lcalfS,
             StateVariable rfootS,
             StateVariable lfootS,
             StateVariable ruarmS,
             StateVariable luarmS,
             StateVariable rlarmS,
             StateVariable llarmS,
             boolean isFailed)
        Make new state from a list of StateVariables. This is now the default way that the GameThreadSafe does it. To make a new State from an existing game, the best bet is to call GameThreadSafe.getCurrentState().
        Parameters:
        bodyS - State of the torso.
        headS - State of the head.
        rthighS - State of the right thigh.
        lthighS - State of the left thigh.
        rcalfS - State of the right shank.
        lcalfS - State of the left shank.
        rfootS - State of the right foot.
        lfootS - State of the left foot.
        ruarmS - State of the right upper arm.
        luarmS - State of the left upper arm.
        rlarmS - State of the right lower arm.
        llarmS - State of the left lower arm.
        isFailed - Whether this state represents a fallen runner.

    • Method Detail

      • getStates

        public StateVariable[] getStates()
        Get the whole array of state variables.
        Returns:
        Array containing a StateVariable for each runner link.

      • getStateVarFromName

        public float getStateVarFromName​(State.ObjectName obj,
                                 State.StateName state)
        Get a specific state value by specifying the link and desired configuration/velocity.
        Parameters:
        obj - Runner body who we want to fetch a state value from.
        state - Configuration/velocity we want to fetch for the specified runner link.
        Returns:
        Value of the requested state.

      • flattenState

        public float[] flattenState()
        Turn the state into an array of floats with body x subtracted from all x coordinates.

      • isFailed

        public boolean isFailed()
        Get whether this state represents a failed runner configuration.
        Returns:
        Runner "fallen" status. True means failed. False means not failed.
